Nonbreeding/immature.description: Nonbreeding and immature Swamp Sparrows can be very similar to Lincoln's Sparrows but usually have rufous in the wings, a neat white throat patch, and no eyering.

Adult (Eastern).description: Song Sparrows have larger bills than Lincoln's Sparrows. Their streaking is coarser, and they don't have the Lincoln's pale eyering or buffy wash across the breast.

Adult.description: Song Sparrows vary across North America, but they always show coarser streaking than Lincoln's Sparrows, without the eyering or the buffy wash on the breast.

Adult (Savannah).description: Savannah Sparrows have shorter, notched tails. They have a yellowish stripe over the eye, no eyering, and lack Lincoln's Sparrow's buffy wash on the breast.

Adult/immature.description: Vesper Sparrows lack the Lincoln's Sparrow's gray face with neat reddish-brown stripes, and they lack the buffy wash to the breast. Vesper Sparrow has white outer tail feathers which Lincoln's lacks.
